Who dis? (About)

My first contact with coding was all the way back in 2005, when I learned that websites are made with HTML. On year later, I got in touch with my first programming language, PHP.
But I really learned programming from a book called C for Dummies by Dan Gookin which shaped the way I think about coding.

Over the years, I played with countless programming and coding languages, from the high levels of JavaScript and HTML, to the low depths of C++, C, even freaking Assembly.
For the most part, I try to follow community guidelines when it comes to how my code looks, but there are edge cases where I feel like those guidelines aren’t making sense, or different people have conflicting ideas on the same topic.

On this website, I will try to write down my own

Cornel's Style Guide

There's 100 Coding Style guides on The Web, so I am joining them to have 101. This one is the result of of my experience, sometimes following other written styles, for as long as they made sense.
